page.title: 08PENNYVENIE FARM-1
page.content:
Pennyvenie and Clawfin are the only farms now left in the Cummock Valley.
There has been a farm at Pennyvenie for more than 300 years. The present mainly stone-built steading replaced one nearby reputed to have been the home of John Patterson, a noted local Covenanter in the seventeenth century. The family now working the farm is directly descended from him.
The cluster of farm buildings lies just off the B741 two kilometres east of Dalmellington. It is a family business and Mr Ireland stocks sheep and a few cattle on his 124 hectares of rough grazing most of it steep open moorland. Near the farmstead there are some greener fields which at intervals are fertilised, ploughed and seeded.
